events.description: Served as the Minister of the Environment under Presidents Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva and Dilma Rousseff.
supporting_quotes: Izabella Teixeira was the Brazilian Minister of the Environment.
In office 30 March 2010 – 12 May 2016
In May 2010 she was appointed Minister of the Environment, and, in January 2011 she was reappointed to the position by Dilma Rousseff, Brazil's new President.

events.description: Earned a Bachelor of Science (BS) degree.
supporting_quotes: Alma mater University of Brasília (BS)

events.organization: COPPE/UFRJ (Federal University of Rio de Janeiro)
events.description: Earned a master's degree in energy planning and a Ph.D. in environmental planning.
supporting_quotes: She has a master's degree in energy planning and a Ph.D. in environmental planning from COPPE/UFRJ (Federal University of Rio de Janeiro).

events.description: Made a statement on behalf of Brazil at the 10th conference on the Convention on Biological Diversity.
supporting_quotes: In October 2010 Teixeira made a statement on behalf of Brazil at the 10th conference on the Convention on Biological Diversity in Nagoya, Japan.

events.description: Spoke at the 2010 United Nations Climate Change Conference.
supporting_quotes: She also spoke at the 2010 United Nations Climate Change Conference in Cancún, Mexico.

events.description: Successfully hosted the Rio+20 UN Conference on Sustainable Development.
supporting_quotes: At home in Brazil, she successfully hosted the Rio+20 (UN Conference on Sustainable Development).

events.role: Member of the High-Level Panel of Eminent Persons on the Post-2015 Development Agenda
supporting_quotes: On 24 September 2012, Teixeira was appointed by UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon to serve on the High-Level Panel of Eminent Persons on the Post-2015 Development Agenda.
